THE POWER OF THE LORD`S PRAYER is a book that focuses on the
importance and power enshrined in the Lord’s Prayer. Mfuneni Mabunda is
ordained by God to teach, influence, and motivate God`s people about his
unconditional love, compassion, generosity, and unmerited favor. He has a
passion and hunger for order and decency in our relationship and
communication with our heavenly Father.
The book reveals the necessity of being entirely dependent upon God and
his trinity as the source of our protection and all our daily needs. The power
of the Lord`s Prayer admonishes us to step aside and allow our Lord Jesus to
control every area of our lives. The book`s aim is to help all the readers to
live free from worry, anxiety, guilt, and stress.
Mfuneni Barnabas Mabunda tries to show the readers of this book that it is
God’s responsibility to meet our desires and aspirations without struggling
or self-effort. What is fundamental about the Power of that Lord’s Prayer is
that it restores the human dignity and stability by encouraging the
importance of Godly values and good ethical behavior in our society. It is a
great privilege that God has raised an author that focuses exactly on what
we need to live successful and prosperous lives.
We thank God for giving us such a precious gift that addresses all our
situations. I personally appreciate the good work done by Mfuneni Barnabas
Mabunda during our lifetime. I appeal to all the readers of this book to
practice the Power of the Lord`s prayer in everything they do. I recommend
this book without hesitation. Rev Nkosi, motivational teacher, founder, and
senior pastor of Word of Salvation Christian Center.
Regards
Rev. L Nkosi
4

deeper understanding of the Lords’ prayer not as a piece of writing for a
Sunday school learner; but a text that unpacks the mysteries of Lord Jesus.
Barnabas has the Grace of understating scriptures and you will be out of
breath when you finish it.
Daniel Noel Mathebula

ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
I would like to thank God for inspiring me to write this book. I am also
grateful for the support of my family; that is my wife Johanna, my three
children: Tolerance, Eddy and Blessing. We have always stuck together
through thick and thin.
7
INTRODUCTION
This book is not meant for any specific church or denomination; but for
everybody who proclaims Jesus as his Lord and Savior. Our attention is
drawn back to the times when one of Jesus’ disciples said to him: ‘Lord,
teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.’ In response to this
request Jesus recited the prayer in about eight sentences. Although
Christians have been reciting it for many centuries; the message
encapsulated in that prayer has not been thoroughly elucidated by some.
What is the meaning of praying? Praying is a way in which we
communicate with God in order to praise Him to glorify His name, and
thank Him for the blessings He bestowed upon us. In prayer we also ask
Him for our needs and desires. Looking at the disciple who asked Jesus to
teach them how to pray, a question which immediately comes to mind is:
‘Didn’t he have needs and desires?’ If he had needs why then ask Jesus
for guidance? The answer is: Our needs and desires do not always reflect
what is good for us but what we think is good for us. We are like children
who do not always know what is good for them. A child relies on his
parents for guidance because he knows that parents always have best
interest of their children at heart. That is why they are better placed to
choose what is best for their children. The same applies to Christians and
Jesus. That is why we should applaud the disciple for such an amazing and
a humble request. The response to the question has positively impacted
the lives of all Christians globally.
When Jesus taught them the prayer He considered what is best for every
Christian; like parents guiding their children. Every single word in that
8
Prayer was well thought of by our Lord. Through this prayer; He outlaid
the parameters within which all Christians should direct their focus.
Therefore; the Lord’s Prayer is one of the main pillars upon which our
Christian faith and salvation is built. As such, its importance cannot be
overemphasized enough.
Now that we know prayer is one of the pillars of Christians faith; it is
therefore time to look deeper into connecting parts of the prayer, like a
mechanic disassembling different parts of the engine and analyses them.
It is now the time to tighten our seatbelts because the JOURNEY IS
ABOUT TO BEGIN!!!
9
CHAPTER I
OUR FATHER
Our attention is drawn to the times when one of Jesus’ twelve disciples
made a formal request regarding the Lord’s Prayer on their behalf: ‘Lord,
teach us how to pray as John taught his disciples’ (Luke 11:1). Apart from
Jesus’ prayer, the bible has no written record that gives an account of
how John the Baptist taught his disciples. It is imperative that as we
continue to learn about this prayer, we should take cognizance of the fact
that in the same vein, Lord Jesus, is also teaching the church of the
twenty-first century how to pray. In our prayer requests, we are asking
God what we desire Him to do for us. The Lord’s Prayer reflects what we
should desire in the eyes of the Lord. He has wisely selected the right
words we should tell God in our prayers.
We are privileged to have Jesus as our tour- guide towards prayer. As it is
written in Proverbs 1: 20 that:’ wisdom is calling out in the streets and
market-places, calling loudly at the city gates and wherever people come
together.’ Let’s answer wisdom’s call by allowing Jesus to be our mentor
and tour guide. He will never lead us astray because He knows the way as
he said in John 14: 6 that: ‘I am the way, the truth, and the life; no one
10
goes to the Father except through me.’ If we want to inherit the Kingdom
of God we must follow His words assiduously and submit ourselves to
Him and follow Him obediently. As we proceed with the prayer, you will
realize that the Lord’s Prayer is interconnected like tiered steps. You
cannot go to the next step before stepping on the previous one. ‘OUR
FATHER’ forms an introductory part of the Lord’s Prayer as uttered by the
King of Glory when He opened his mouth and started leading them. What
does this statement tells us? It tells us to whom we are directing our
prayers. It is like writing a letter; you don’t start writing your message
before writing a salutation. The same applies here; we are directing our
prayer to ‘OUR FATHER’. According to the Longman Dictionary
contemporary English, the word ‘father’ means a male parent. The word
‘father’ in its general form has a connotation of referring to someone
superior, whom one can rely on, more especially when in dire need of
protection.
Let’s look at this two words statement and its diverse meanings regarding
our relationship with God. How is this important? It is very important
because Jesus Christ was teaching his disciples how to pray. It helps us to
understand and evaluate or introspect ourselves if we are within the
umbrella of people whom Jesus is teaching this prayer. The connotation
of this statement is that He is our father and we are His children. Then,
there comes a probing question: Are you the child of God? Secondly;
what qualifies one to be the child of God.
We have to refer to the scriptures to get an appropriate answer. John 1:
12, 13 say: ‘Some, however, did receive him and believed in him; so he
gave them the right to become God’s children…’ They did not become
God’s children based on human will of the father and mother. God was
11
their father. We can’t avoid asking ourselves that: how did God himself
became their father? To answer that question appropriately, let’s check
what the bible says in Genesis 2: 7: ‘The Lord God took some soil from the
ground and formed man out of it. He breathed a life-giving breath into his
nostrils, and he began to leave.’ Then the LORD God made the man fall
asleep, and while he was sleeping, He took out one of the man’s ribs and
closed up the flesh. He formed a woman out of the rib and brought her to
him (Genesis 2: 21-22. If God Himself created Adam and Eve; doesn’t that
make us children of God as their descendent? The answer is NO. We
should remember that God expelled and disowned them after they
rebelled against Him by their act of disobedience of not keeping His
commandments. This matter will be dealt with later.
What we gather from the scriptures quoted above is that the body of a
person is lifeless without a life-giving breath. Therefore the soul forms
the living part of every person while the body clothes it just like a
garment. Paul put it explicitly at 1 Corinthians 15: 40 when he says: ‘And
there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies, the beauty that belongs to
heavenly bodies is different from the beauty that belongs to earthly
bodies.’ Garments are meant to cover our bodies; they are like shelters.
Although our earthly bodies are like garments; our souls are given to
serve the interest of our mortal bodies throughout our lives. That is why
the baby cries when he or she is hungry, and then after being breast-fed
the baby stops crying and begins to play. As he grows, so is the desire of
the flesh. He will start to labor like his counter-parts in order to serve the
needs and desires of the earthly body. In that way the body becomes the
master of the life giving breath. Throughout his life his activities will be
within the confines of the garment. When the garment is destroyed and it
is buried underground where it belongs; the soul become aware that I’ve
12
been serving darkness all along. Don’t get me wrong; I don’t say it is
wrong to take good care of our bodies. To say that it will be against God’s
word; for he says: ‘In the sweat of thy face shall though eat bread till
though return to the ground.’ All I am saying is; we should see beyond
the flesh we are clothed with.
If we don’t do that it means we are in darkness and it is ruling over us as
Revelation 3: 17 say: ‘You say I am rich and well off; I have all I need. But
you do not know how miserable and pitiful you are! You are poor, naked,
and blind. I advise you, then, to buy gold from me, pure gold, in order to be
rich. Buy also white clothing to dress yourself and cover up your shameful
nakedness. Buy also some ointment to put on your eyes, so that you may
see.’ Why is Jesus telling people who are rich and well off that they are
‘poor, naked and blind?’ An appropriate answer is found at Mathew 15: 14
when Jesus said: ‘don’t worry about them! They are blind leaders of the
blind; and when one blind man leads another, both fall into the ditch.’ The
same applies here. Our main focus is on the two bodies; that is the earthly
body and the heavenly body. Among the two bodies the one who is
allegedly rich in this case is the earthly body which is lifeless like a garment.
All this wealth will not serve the heavenly body when the earthly body is
destroyed. The earthly bodies are temporal shelter for the heavenly bodies
as 2 Corinthians 5: 1 says: ‘For we know that when this tent we live in – our
body here on earth is torn down, God will have a house in heaven for us to
live in.’
In order to shed more light about these two bodies let me tell you a real
story. Some years ago while I was still working for the department of
health and welfare I met a certain lady who shared with me her real story.
She said that she was pregnant and had complications when she went on
labor. She took her two year old child when she went to the hospital.
Doctors told her that she had to undergo caesarian operation. She said
13
that while they were busy operating her, she realized that she left her
body. She saw herself standing some few meters away from her body,
watching everything they were doing. She could hear everything they
said. She said because of some complications they had to transfer her to
another hospital. When they wheeled her to the ambulance she followed
them and walk close to her body. Then, in the ambulance on their way to
another hospital her two year-old child tearfully hugged her copse, asked
and pleaded with her to wake up. With sympathy she jumped forward
and embraced the child. That was the moment she woke up.
That revelation had been a reviving inspiration to my spirituality. After
she had finished unpacking her ordeal, I started to affirm the existence of
an immortal body which is spiritual. I thought about the two bodies for a
long time. The marriage between the earthly bodies will surely come to
an end. I remembered what Job said at Job 17: 11-14 when he said: ‘My
days have passed; my plans have failed; my hope is gone. But my friends
say that night is daylight; they say that light is near, but I know I remain in
darkness. My only hope is the world of the dead, where I will lie down to
sleep in the dark. I will call the grave my father, and the worms that eat
me I will call my mother and my sisters’.
Some people are in need of light and that light is Jesus, but all their needs
and desires are tied down to their earthly bodies. They do not care about
their lives after death. Our life now is worth but without Jesus, the giver
of eternal life, it is void and hopeless; it is like a circle. The winning post is
where you started. We ululate and clap our hands for the winners; those
who labor and spend sleepless night amassing wealth but when they die
they are bereft of their wealth. Solomon who was the richest king and the
wisest king the world has ever produced. At Ecclesiastes 5: 15-16 he that:’
14
we leave this world just as we entered it-with nothing. In spite of all our
work there is nothing we can take with us. Is it not right? We go just as
we came. We labor, trying to catch the wind, and what do we get?’ That
is why Revelation 3: 17 says: ‘you say, ‘I am rich; but you do not
know how miserable and pitiful you are! You are poor, naked and blind.’
There is a strong similarity between King Solomon’s words and Jesus’s. In
his quest for wisdom, King Solomon’s thoughts pushed him towards Jesus
territory. He stood at the closed door which only King Jesus would unlock
many centuries to come. He searched for answers; with his thoughts
troubling him. We get that in Ecclesiastes 2:18 when he said: ‘Nothing
that I had worked for and earned meant a thing to me, because I will have
to leave it to my successor.’ It is apparent that the king wanted life
beyond his earthly body.
Then, what do we do? The same question was asked during the day of
Pentecost at Acts 2: 37 when they said: ‘What shall we do, brothers?’
Peter said to them: ‘Each one of you must turn away from your sins and
be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ, so that your sins will be forgiven;
and you will receive God’s gift, the Holy Spirit.’ When you are baptized
God gives you the Holy Spirit. The first person to baptize people was John
the Baptist. He was immersing them in water and said: ‘I baptize you with
water to show that you have repented, but the one who will come after
me will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire (Mathew 3: 11).’
According to this statement there are two types of baptisms. There is the
baptism by water which was practiced by John. And there is the baptism
by the Holy Spirit and fire which would be practiced by Jesus. These two
types of baptisms were not practiced simultaneously but in different
phases. When John mentioned baptism by the Holy Spirit he was pointing
to the future; specifically prophesizing about Jesus Christ. John did not
15
instruct his disciples to baptize with water after him. We get that when an
argument between John‘s disciples and the Jew started. John’s disciples
went to him and asked: ‘Teacher, you remember the man who was with
you on the east side of Jordan, the one you spoke about? Well, he is
baptizing now, and everyone is going to him!’ John answered, ‘No one
can have anything unless God gave it to him. You yourselves are
witnesses that I said: ‘I am not the messiah, but I have been sent ahead of
him.’ The bridegroom is the one to whom the bride belongs; but the
bridegroom’s friend, who stand by and listens, is glad when he hears the
bridegroom’s voice. This is how my own happiness is made complete. He
must become more important while I become less important. (John 3: 26-
30). By saying those words John was denouncing his baptism and uplifting
Jesus’s baptism, the Holy Spirit. Jesus instructed his disciples to baptize in
the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit. (Mathew 28: 18-19).
For more you can also read Acts 19: 1-6 and Acts 18:24-26.
When we baptize we are not baptizing the mortal body but the spirit.
Romans 8: 16 says: ‘God’s spirit joins himself to our spirits to declare that
we are God’s children.’ And that answer the question we had earlier on
that: ‘how God himself became their Father?’ Then, what does being
God’s children mean? Just as God’s spirit does not belong to this world
we also do not belong to this world. Jesus put it clearly in John 17:16
when he said: ‘Just as I do not belong to the world, they do not belong to
the world.’ Baptism by the Holy Spirit is like a visa. What is a visa?
According to an advanced learners dictionary:’ a visa is a stamp or mark
put in your passport by officials of a foreign country that gives you
permission to enter, pass through or leave their country.’ A visa gives a
person a right to have equivalent privileges which are enjoyed by citizen
of that country. Immigration officers will likely turn away any person who
16
tries to enter their country without a visa. Likewise people who did not
receive the baptism of the Holy Spirit will not enter the gate of Heaven.
‘God is the one who has prepared us for this change, and He gave us His
Holy Spirit as a guarantee of all that He has in store for us (2
Corinthians5:5).’ It is the same Holy Spirit who gave us power to call Him
Father. As God’s children we have a right to call him ‘Father’ just like
Jesus Christ; hence he advised us to address our prayer to our Father.
As God’s children we have a responsibility to show Him respect when we
pray. Some people don’t pray to God while standing on their feet. They
kneel down to show respect as Philippians 2: 10 says: ‘and so, in honor of
the name of Jesus all beings in heaven, on earth, and in the world below
will fall on their knees. ‘It should be noted that ‘beings in heaven’ the
bible is referring to angels. They also kneel down to show respect to King
Jesus. Psalms 95: 6 says: ‘Come, let us bow down and worship him; let us
kneel before the Lord, our maker.’ Jesus himself knelt before the Lord,
see Luke 22: 41, which say: ‘Then he went off from them about the
distance of a stone’s throw and knelt down and prayed.’ When you kneel
down you are humbling yourself before the Lord.
17
CHAPTER 2
WHO ART IN HEAVEN
‘WHO ART IN HEAVEN:’ This is the second statement of the Lord’s Prayer.
We are still talking about our father; but we have moved to the next step:
‘WHO ART IN HEAVEN.’ What does ‘WHO’ in this statement tells us? It
calls for a description of ‘OUR FATHER’. ‘It differentiates our God with
other gods. It is giving us more clarity about ‘OUR FATHER’ by telling us
that He art in heaven. Although Jesus has already told us that He art in
heaven but there is still more we should know as children of God. By
knowing ‘WHO’ is our God will help us as his children to relate well with
him. As his children we need to know his likes and dislikes. That will put
us in a better position to know what he expects from us as his children.
Abraham received mercy from the eyes of the Lord and he made sure
that he introduced himself to Him when he made a covenant with Him in
Genesis 17: 1 which says: ‘when Abraham was ninety-nine years old, the
Lord appeared to him and said: ‘I am the Almighty God, obey me and
always do what is right.’ He wanted Abraham to take notice that he is
having complete power and he must obey him and always do what is
right. Just like us; we want our children to respect and obey us. God also
expects the same from us as His children. If we do that He will never
forsake us. You might have heard about magicians, idolatrous, witches,
18
and etcetera; people who make things happen with their magic. They
might be powerful but our God is more powerful than all of them. As
children of God we must not be afraid of them. Our God, the Almighty,
created all of them. Our Father in Heaven; who is our God is not some
kind of a man-made idol. Isaiah 66: 1 says: ‘The Lord says, ‘Heaven is my
throne, and the earth is my footstool. You look at the sun; it throws its
bright and hot rays throughout the whole universe. You look at the
mountains, the sea, the stars, and etcetera. God said a word and they all
emerged. He is God without a beginning or end. Unlike all of us; He has
no date of birth. He has always been there and He will always be there. ‘I
am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, the Beginning and the
End (Revelation 22: 13).’ I will explain further about ‘WHO’ is our God.
This is important to our relationship with Him as I stated above.
He alone is worthy of praise.’ He doesn’t want to share his glory and
honor with any other gods. He is as jealous to his children like a man to
his wife. He wants his children to worship Him alone. Jeremiah 1: 16 say:
‘I will punish my people because they have sinned; they have abandoned
me, have offered sacrifices to other gods, and have made idols and
worshipped them.’ This is a warning that all God’s children cannot afford
to ignore because God’s promises stand and do not change like weather.
What God promise to do He will surely do. When you turn to other gods
rather than to Him you are like a married person who is cheating on his
partner. The partner’s anger will rise and explode like a bomb.
The Lord God hates people who don’t believe in Him. His anger rose
against the Israelites when they revolted against Him at Kadesh in the
wilderness of Paran after Moses sent some spies to go and explore the
land of Canaan. They feared the giants of Canaan instead of believing in
God who defended them in the hands of Egyptians. God said to them:
19
‘But I promise that as surely as I live and as surely as my presence fills the
earth, none of these people will live to enter that land. They have seen
the dazzling light of my presence and the miracles that I performed in
Egypt and in the wilderness, but they have tried my patience over and
over again and have refused to obey me (Numbers 14: 20-22).’ Those
Israelites doubted God’s ability to save them in the hands of Canaanites in
spite of all the miracles he performed in Egypt. God took that as an insult
and a mockery to his power and sovereignty. When you doubt God you
are indirectly saying: God; I don’t think you will be able to help me
because this situation is too tough for you. You are also questioning God’s
loyalty to stick to His word. God take that as an intolerable insult, and He
will surely not let it go unpunished. Your punishment is in twofold; your
fear which deprives you of inner piece is a thorn to your heart. You might
end up acquiring psychosomatic diseases like heart attack, stress,
depression, and etcetera. Secondly, you face God’s wrath for insulting
Him.
A perfect example is found in Luke 1: 8-20 which read as follows: ‘One
day Zechariah was doing his work as a priest in the Temple, taking his turn
in the daily service. According to the custom followed by the priests, he
was chosen by the Lord to burn incense of the Lord. So he went into the
Temple of the Lord, while the crowd of people outside prayed during the
hour when the incense was burnt. An angel of the Lord appeared to him,
standing on the right of the altar where the incense was burnt. When
Zechariah saw him, he was alarmed and felt afraid, Zechariah! God has
heard your prayer, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son. You are to
name him John. How glad and happy you will be, and how happy others
will be when he is born! He will be a great man in the Lord’s sight. He
must not drink any wine or strong drink. From his very birth he will be
20
filled with the Holy Spirit, and he will bring back many of the people of
Israel to the Lord their God. He will go ahead of the Lord, strong and
mighty like the prophet Elijah. He will bring fathers and children together
again; he will turn disobedient people back to the way of thinking of
righteous; he will get the Lord’s people ready for him.’ Zechariah said to
the angel, ‘How shall I know if this is so? I am an old man and my wife
is old also.’ ‘I am Gabriel, ‘the angel answered. ‘I stand in the presence of
God, who sent me to speak to you and tell you this good news. But you
have not believed my message, which will come true at the right time.
Because you have not believed, you will be unable to speak; you will
remain silent until the day my promise to you comes true.’
The above incident is the perfect example of God’s intolerance to people
who don’t believe in Him. When we look at the situation above it was
humanly impossible for Zechariah’s wife (Elizabeth) to conceive because
of old age. Then, why did the angel become angry with him for speaking
the truth. The answer goes back to what Jesus is trying to bring to our
attention in his opening statement when he said: ‘Our Father.’ He doesn’t
stop there. He went on to specify to us that: ‘which Father is he talking
about? The answer being that: the one ‘WHO ART IN HEAVEN.’ He is the
one who created heaven, the earth, the sea and everything in them
without lifting a finger; but with his word. As John 1: 3 says: ‘through him
God made all things; not one thing in all creation was made without him.’
He wants his children to understand that; so that they may believe in Him.
So, when you pray you must have a clear understanding about his power.
He can’t tolerate people who are belittling Him by doubting His ability and
calling Him a liar. And this is what Zechariah did when the angel told him
the good news. He allowed adversity of their old age to interfere with his
faith; and that is tantamount to insubordination. That is why the angel
21
struck him with muteness. God like people who believe in Him and He
will do everything for them.
Let’s look at Mathew 17: 13-20 which reads as follows: ‘when they
returned to the crowd, a man came to Jesus, knelt before him and said:
‘Sir, have mercy on my son! He is an epileptic and has such terrible
attacks that he often falls in the fire or into water. I brought him to your
disciple, but they could not heal him.’ Jesus answered: ‘how unbelieving
and wrong you people are! How long must I stay with you? Bring the boy
here to me!’ Jesus gave a command to the demon, and it went out of the
boy, and at the very moment he was healed. Then the disciples came to
Jesus in private and asked him: ‘why couldn’t we drive the demon out?’
‘It was because you haven’t enough faith,’ answered Jesus. ‘I assure you
that if you have faith as big as a mustard seed, you can say to this hill, go
from here to there and it will go. You could do anything.’
Other people will say: Is it really true that ‘you can say to this hill, go from
here to there and it will go. Well, Jesus said it but it sound too much to be
true. I can confirm unreservedly that it is really true. People who are flesh
and blood like you and me did similar miracle or even more because of
their unwavering faith. Socio-technological developments of our age
confirm that King Jesus did mean what he said. As a result of that promise
gigantic machines are able to fly over the sky; we are in the age of
satellite where we are able to watch events which are happening more
than three thousand miles away, and etcetera.
Faith is like a pin code which gives you access to unlimited supernatural
forces of the almighty. Whenever you intend to withdraw money at the
automated teller machine you must have your pin code ready. Before the
machine processes your request it will instruct you to enter your pin
code. You can have your correct bank card but if you lost or misquote
22
your pin code the machine will not process your request. There are many
people around the world who are able to access the unlimited
supernatural forces of the almighty through the principle of prayer and
faith.
About twenty five years ago I had a life changing experience of my life. I
was still working at the public service under The Department of Health
and Welfare. It was about six o’clock and I was bathing when I heard a
knock at the door. I ignored it but the knock persisted. I wrapped myself
with a towel stepped out of the bath and went to open the door. At the
doorstep I saw a haggard- looking old lady. I looked at her with a frown
and wondered what might have brought her to my place at that ungodly
hour. After exchanging greetings she said: ‘my child I know you are a
Christian since I usually see you down the street going to church every
day. May you please follow me to my homestead so that you can pray for
my granddaughter? She is shivering with delirium. Her eyes are yellowish
and rolling out.’ I told her that I am not a pastor; and moreover time is
against me since I had to go to work because I was expected to be at work
by 7: 30 AM that morning. She said that even if I am not a pastor God will
listen to me. She stood at the door and looked at me pleadingly. I
impatiently looked at her wishing she could understand and leave me to
continue with my bath; moreover my bathing water was getting cold as I
was standing at the door with her. Then she said: ‘just say a word I
believe God will do as you say.’ And I said: ‘don’t worry mum your
granddaughter will get well.’ She was downcast most of the time but she
cocked up her head then; and looked at me hopefully and said: ‘you say
so my child.’ I looked at her and I saw faith suffusing on her face. I agreed
enthusiastically and said: ‘your granddaughter will surely be well. ‘Alright
my son thanks you a lot,’ she said while she turned and walked away.
23
Suddenly, I saw a flash of bright light crossing the room. I frowned with
amazement because the sky was clear. I then dismissed it and thought it
was only a figment of my imagination. Relieved I went back to continue
with my bath.
Later the same day after knocking off duty I decided to go and see her.
She warmly welcomed me into her house. After exchanging greetings
with her I asked her: ‘where is the sick child?’ ‘Oh you mean that one I
told you about in the morning?’ She asked. ‘Yes!’ I replied. ‘You forgot
that you said she would get well. When I came back from your place she
instantly had a running stomach. And after that she got well. She is
playing outside. When she said that I started to remember what
happened at my place when I told her that her granddaughter would be
well. I realized then that a flash of bright light I saw was a signal that her
faith was withdrawing supernatural forces which healed her
granddaughter. Thanks to her faith; she remembered the pin code and
she was able to rescue her granddaughter. Besides miracles we always
read about in the bible there are countless miracles experienced by men
and women who did not forget the pin code. You too can access that
supernatural force of the almighty if you remember your pin code which
is FAITH.
24
CHAPTER 3
HALLOWED BE THY NAME
‘HALLOWED BE THY NAME;’ this is the third step in our tiered steps as we
move on. What does this statement tells us? To ‘hallow’ is to keep
something ‘holy’ or ‘sacred.’ A sacred item or a sacred personality
deserves great respect, more especially if it has a connection with God.
Now, we have freely acquired unmerited favor by God’s divine grace of
receiving the rights to be called His children; and He is our ‘Father.’ What
does it mean? Nature dictates: ’A cow begets a cow’. The same applies to
us as children of God; we also bear His name as Psalm 82: 6 says: ‘I have
said to you, you are gods, and all of you are children of The Most High’.
This scripture says children of God are also gods. Why is that so? Don’t
forget how you became the child of God. You are the child of God
because his Spirit is in you. Romans 8: 16 says: ‘God’s Spirit joins himself
to our spirits to declare that we are God’s children.’ So; being God’s
children goes with its own price; we should emulate him in holiness as
Peter 1: 15 says: ‘but as he who has called you is holy, so be holy in
manner of conduct.’
Exodus 20: 7 says: ‘you shall not take the name of the LORD your God in
vain, for the LORD will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.’
Being the child of God means that you must abide by his rules; you’ve
25
become his bride. You don’t belong to yourself anymore but to Him;
you’ve surrendered yourself to Him. Romans 7: 4 says: ‘therefore my
brethren, you also have become dead to the law by the body of Christ,
that you should be married to another, even to him who is raised from
the dead that we should bring forth fruit unto God.’ To shed more light
about this let me tell you a story.
There was a lady who was staying alone in a big house. She had everything
but was having a big problem. It started one day when she heard a knock
on her door. On opening the door she found that it was the devil standing
at the doorstep. Without saying anything he beat her up to a pulp and left
her lying unconscious. When she woke up she realized that he was gone.
He did that every day. One day on her way to the market she met Jesus
and told him all her problems she was experiencing. Jesus said to her: ‘if
you can welcome me into your house all your problems will be over. I will
deal with the bastard myself. She became very much excited and took
Jesus to her house, unlocked the door and together they went to the
lounge where she motioned him to the sofa and told him to relax. Thirty
minutes later there was a knock at the door. She opened the door and
called in the visitor. And there standing at the door was the devil again.
Without saying a word he started beating her, left her lying and bleeding
on the floor. Jesus just sat on the sofa and watched the drama. She woke
up and asked Jesus: ‘you promised to protect me if I can welcome you into
my house, but now you just sat there while the monster beat me up to a
pulp. And Jesus answered: ‘you said it all when you say:’ you welcomed me
into your house.’ I also acknowledged that this is your house; I am only a
visitor here. So, mind your own business. Then she asked: ‘what should I
do?’ Jesus said: ‘surrender the whole house and yourself to me; I will then
take responsibility’. She then surrendered the house. ‘From now
26
henceforth the house is yours,’ she said to Him. Thirty minutes later there
was a knock at the door. When she stood up, Jesus said to her: We agreed
that the house is no longer yours but mine. So, sit down I will attend to
whoever is knocking. When Jesus opened the door he saw the devil
standing at the doorstep. When the devil saw Jesus he fled back like a
missile without looking back. Since that day he never came back. That was
the end of that lady’s misery; because she surrendered herself to Jesus.
After surrendering the house to Jesus it did not belong to her any longer
but to Jesus. Jesus was responsible for the house after that agreement.
That is why Jesus admonished her when she stood up to attend to the
visitor when he knocked at the door. She had responsibility to respect the
new owner of the house who was Jesus. The same applies to us as God’s
children. Jesus shed his own blood to buy us from God’s rejection. We no
longer belong to ourselves; but to God. Therefore our bodies are sacred
and must be respected. If we defile our bodies we will face God’s wrath. As
His children, He will treat us as we treat our children. It is our duty as
parents to protect our children. We also provide for their needs and
desires. If you want to face the wrath of any parent touch his child. The
same applies to God. He is overprotective over His children who keep His
word. Similarly, as we punish our children when they err; God will also
punish us when we break His laws because we are his children. Hebrew 11:
6-9 says: ‘Because the Lord corrects everyone He loves, and punishes
everyone He accepts as His child. Endure the pain that comes from Him
who sometimes rebuke and reprimand us.’ The bible says if you stray away
from the law and God does not punish you it means you are a bastard.
What is a bastard? A bastard is a child who was born out of wedlock. If I
marry a woman who comes with a child from a previous marriage I don’t
correct him even if he errs.
27
Why? I don’t punish him because he is not my blood. That means I don’t
love him enough. The same applies here. If God does not punish us it
means he does not love us. A perfect example is the case of King David.
God loved him and he was referred to as the man after God’s own heart.
But when he erred by sleeping with Uriah’s wife and plotted his death in
the heat of the battle God did punish him. The child whom Uriah’s wife had
born to him died. There are blessings and punishments which will follow us
as children of God. There will be blessings if we keep his laws and
punishments if we stray away from the law.
As God’s children we have duty to revere the one who is in us. Accepting
Jesus Christ as our Lord and savior is not a step to be taken lightly. Your
lives change from that day; it is like people who are getting married. Both
their lives change from the day they enter into matrimony. The man must
love and respect his wife and the woman must also love and respect her
husband. Whatever they do they need to consider if their actions will go
down well with their partners. Both their lives changes drastically. Paul
puts it explicitly at Ephesians 4: 22-24 when he says: ‘that you put off
concerning the former way of life of the old man, who is corrupt
according to the deceitful lusts; and be renewed in the spirit of your
mind. And that you put on the new man, who is created to be like God in
righteousness and true holiness.’ It means we change our ways of life;
that is fornication, immoral, filthy and indecent actions in honour of the
Holy Spirit we are clothed with.
Unfortunately many people are ignoring this important statement:
‘Hallowed be thy name’. My point is; as children of God we have submitted
ourselves to him. You are no longer in control of yourself. Your lives belong
to him as 1 Corinthians 6: 19 say: ‘Do you not know that your bodies are
28
the temples of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have of God, and
you are not your own?.’ There is a strong similarity between this scripture
and the case of this poor lady explained above. I am amazed when I see
advertisement in newspapers of witchdoctors claiming to give people
spiritual power so that they can go and deceive people by claiming to have
God’s healing power. They falsely proclaim the name of Jesus and deceive
many people, thereby deviling the same name Jesus said it must be
revered. And what partnership has light with darkness? And what harmony
has Christ with Belial? Or what does a believer have in common with an
unbeliever. And what agreement has the temple of God with idols? For you
are the temple of God, as God had said, I will dwell in them, and I will be
their God, and they shall be my people.’ So, the child of God must stay
away from such people who are wolves clothed in ship skin.
29
CHAPTER 4
THY KINGDOM COME
Many Christian throughout the whole world are asking for the Kingdom of
God to come in their prayers. The question is: do we clearly understand
what we are praying for. Do we even know the meaning of the ‘Kingdom
of God?’ What will happen when the Kingdom of God comes? All this
questions should be clarified in our subsequent discussion below.
What is the kingdom of God? In general knowledge a Kingdom is country
ruled by the king. And there must be laws regulating the smooth running
of that country. Most importantly, there must be a King in a Kingdom.
Then, who is the king in God’s Kingdom? The answer is Jesus Christ.
Mathew 28: 18-20 say: ‘and Jesus came and spoke to them, saying: all
authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth. Go, therefore and
make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the
Father, and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all
things that I have commanded you; and behold, I am with you always,
even to the end of the age. Amen.’
Jesus proclaimed to have been given all authority in heaven and here on
earth. What does this statement mean? It means His Kingdom stretches
from Heaven to earth. In Heaven He rules over angels, the creatures and
the elders. But how is He ruling here on earth and who are His subjects?
30
He is ruling his children or his elect through his counselor the Holy Spirit.
John 14: 16-20 say: ‘and I will ask the Father, and he will give you another
Councilor to be with you forever; the Spirit of truth. The world cannot
accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know
him, for he lives with you and will be in you. I will not live you as orphans;
I will come to you. Before long, the world will not see me anymore, but
you will see me, because I live, you will live.’
The Holy Spirit represents Jesus here on earth. He is doing everything
Jesus was doing during His tenure here on earth. He does everything
Jesus asked him to do. He is like a road map; directing us to Heaven.
When the Holy Spirit is within us, it is like we are living with Jesus, we are
walking with Him. Then, with that in mind we can now explain the
meaning of ‘God’s Kingdom’. Jesus answered that question at Luke 17:
20-21 which read as follows: ‘and when he was demanded by the
Pharisees when the Kingdom of God should come,’ he answered them
and said: ‘the Kingdom of God comes not with outward observation.
Neither shall they say, behold here! Or, behold there! For behold, the
Kingdom of God is in the midst of you.’ The exact meaning of Jesus
answer is that the Kingdom of God cannot be seen nor can we point at it.
Paul said almost similar words at Romans 14: 17 which say: ‘for the
Kingdom of God is not food and drink, but righteousness, and peace, and
joy in the Holy Spirit.’ What does these statements by Jesus and Paul
means? It means when the Kingdom of God come the Holy Spirit will
reign in our hearts and bring righteousness, peace, and joy. That is why at
Galatians 5: 22-23 Paul says:’ the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, and
long-suffering gentleness, goodness, and self-control.
In order to shed more light about the ‘Kingdom of God’ let us look at
Mathew 3: 1-2 which say: ‘In those days John the Baptist came, preaching
31
in the Desert of Judea and saying: repent for the Kingdom of heaven is
near.’ The nagging question is: were John’s words fulfilled? I answer that
unequivocally with ‘yes;’ they were fulfilled. Matthew 3: 16 say: ‘and
Jesus when he was baptized went up immediately out of water: and, lo,
the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the spirit of God
descending like a dove, and lighting upon him.’ This was in fulfillment of
John’s words at Mathew 3: 11 which say: ‘indeed I baptize you with water
unto repentance: but he that comes after me is mightier than I, whose
shoes I am not worthy to bear, he shall baptize you with the Holy Spirit
and fire.’ There are two ways of baptisms here: It is the baptism of water
which John was practicing at that particular time he was saying those
words. There is the baptism of the Holy Spirit and the fire which would be
used by Jesus Christ.
Then, what does the issue of baptism has to do with the Kingdom of God?
Baptism is where a Christian is transformed from his or her old self into a
new creation. That’s where ‘God’s Spirit joins himself to our spirit to
declare that we are God’s children’ (Romans 8: 16). Galatians 3: 27 say:
‘for as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.’
Just like our spirits which are clothed with our outside bodies; our spirits
will be clothed with Christ when we are baptized. When you are baptized
with the Holy Spirit you are dedicating your life to Jesus. Your body
acquires a new owner which is the Holy Spirit; and the Holy Spirit comes
from heaven. That is why we no longer belong to this world; but we are
citizen of heaven. Philippians 3: 20 say: ‘For our citizenship is in heaven,
from which we also look for the savior, the Lord Jesus Christ.’ What does
this mean? It means we have become the ambassadors of heaven. We no
longer belong to this world. Like in the world we live in; every country has
its own King and its own laws. Our King is in heaven and we are being
32
ruled by heavenly laws. I don’t mean Christians should disobey the law of
the country. 1Peter 2:13-18 says: ‘submit yourselves for the Lord’s sake to
every authority instituted among men. Whether to the king, as the
supreme authority, or to governors, who are sent by him to punish those
who do wrong and to commend those who do right; for it is God’s will
that by doing good you should silence the ignorant talk of foolish men.
Live as free people, but do not use your freedom as a cover-up for evil,
live as servants of God. Show proper respect to everyone. Love the
brotherhood of believers, fear God, and honor the king. Slaves, submit
yourselves to your masters with all respect, not only to those who are
good and considerate, but also to those who are harsh.’ Because Paul
says: ‘we respect the authority here on earth because of our father in
heaven’.
The Holy Spirit is like a visa which we use when we want to visit another
country. A visa is an official document you use from a foreign country
which gives you a right to enter and leave that country. Without a visa an
immigration officer of that country will not allow you to enter. The same
applies with the Holly Spirit which comes from heaven. The Holy Spirit
gives us access to enter heaven. Paul puts it clearly at 2 Corinthians 5: 1, 5
when he said: ‘for we know if our earthly house of this tabernacle were
dissolved, we have a building of God, a house not made with hands,
eternal in heaven. Now he that has made us for the same thing is God,
who also has given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.’ According to the
advanced learner dictionary; a tabernacle: is ‘a small place of worship
that could be moved, used by the Jews in ancient times when they were
travelling in the desert.’ A tabernacle was convenient to the Israelites
while they were still travelling because it could be moved. But when they
reached their destiny it became obsolete; and was replaced by the temple
33
which was built by King Solomon. While they were still travelling they did
not mind their temporal sufferings; their mind was set on the Promised
Land. The same applies to us as Christians; we disregard our struggle
because we are looking forward to our life with Christ in heaven. 2
Corinthian 5: 7 say: ‘for we walk by faith not by sight.’ like a grain mustard
seed, which a person took and sowed in his field; which indeed is the
least of all seeds; but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and
become a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the
branches thereof.’ Jesus is comparing the Kingdom of heaven with a
mustard seed which was the smallest of all seeds. One can hardly
recognize something which is very small. That is why we trample ants
when we walk. It is because of their small size. The same applies to
human race regarding the Kingdom of God; they undervalue it. But like a
mustard seed which grows into a big tree which the birds of the air came
and lodged in the branches; so is the Kingdom of God. We were once in
his Kingdom; but were rejected because of the sin of one man; Adam. The
word of God is here to recall us from rejection; now, we are being called
back through the grace of our Lord and savior Jesus Christ. Romans 5: 17
say: ‘For if, by the trespass of one man, death reigned through that one
man, how much more will those who receive God’s abundant provision of
grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man,
Jesus Christ.’ God will impose judgment upon people who unheeded his
call. John 3: 19 say: ‘this is the verdict: light has come into the world, but
people loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil.’
It is like during the time of Noah. When God instructed him to build an
ark; people did not take him seriously. To them it was like a joke until God
sent a flood on the earth which engulfed all of them. People mocked at
the construction of an ark which was supposed to save them from the
34
flood. Salvation is like Noah’s ark; and similarly it is like the mustard seed
which is the smallest of all seeds, but it will grow into a big tree. People
who did not mock and look down upon salvation; but accepted Jesus
Christ will find solace in the Kingdom of God. The time will come when
people will realize that what they valued in their life time was
unimportant. Amos 8: 11 say: ‘the time is coming when I will send famine
on the land. People will be hungry, but not for bread; they will be thirsty,
but not for water. They will hunger and thirst for a message from the
LORD. I, the Sovereign LORD, have spoken. People will wander from the
Dead Sea to the Mediterranean and then on from the north to the east.
They will look everywhere for a message from the LORD, but they will not
find it.’ During that time there will be one King; and that King is Jesus. The
end of times is near when God will impose judgment for those who
rejected his reign (Kingdom) during their lifetime.
THE SECOND COMING OF JESUS CHRIST
Daniel prophesied about the end of times in Daniel 2: 44 which say: ‘the
God of heavens will set up a Kingdom that will never be destroyed, nor
will it be left to another person. It will crush all those kingdoms and bring
them to an end, but it will itself endure forever.’ Jesus promised his
disciples that he’s coming back. We are now witnessing signs of his coming
back. In Mathew 24: 23-28 he said: ‘at that time if anyone says to you, look
here is the Christ or there he is, do not believe it. For false Christ and false
prophets will appear and perform great signs and miracles to deceive even
the elect-if that were possible; so I have told you ahead of time. So if
anyone tells you, there he is, out in the desert, do not go out; or, here he is
35
in the inner room, do not believe it. For as lightning that comes from the
east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the son of Man.
Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather. Immediately
after the distress of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will
not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies
will be shaken. At that time the sign of the sun of man will appear in the
sky, and all the nations of the earth will mourn. They will see the son of
man coming on the clouds of the sky.’ We are witnessing all the sign Jesus
spoke about. False prophets are performing great miracles. Mathew 24: 40
say: ‘two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left. Two
women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other
left.’ 1Thessalonians 4: 17 say: After that, we who are still alive and are left
will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the
air.’ That is why the scripture says: ‘wherever there is a carcass, there the
vultures will gather’. God will take the elect away before imposing his
punishment to the world. Revelation 18: 4 say: ‘then I heard another voice
from heaven say: come out of her my people, so that you will not receive
any of her plagues.’ Yes, God will send plagues through angels when they
sounded their trumpets. That is why the elect will be taken away before he
sends those plagues. God will not set up his Kingdom here on earth.
36
THE FINAL JUDGMENT
‘Then I saw a great white throne and him who was seated on it. Earth and
sky fled from his presence, and then there was no place for them. And I
saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and books
were opened. Another book was opened, which is the book of life. The
dead were judged according to what they had done as recorded in the
books. The sea gave up the dead that were in it, and death and Hades
gave up the dead that were in them, and each person was judged
according to what he has done. Then, death and Hades were thrown into
the lake of fire. The lake of fire is the second death. If anyone’s name was
not found written in the book of life, he or was thrown into the lake of
fire (Revelation 12: 11-15). You need to know this! The above scripture
say: ‘if anyone’s name was not found written in the book of life, he was
thrown into the lake of fire.’ IMPORTANT QUESTION: who are those
people who are recorded in the book of life? ANSWER: it is those people
who have been baptized with the Holy Spirit and lived by God’s words as
Matthew 7:21 says: ‘not everyone who calls me ‘Lord, Lord will enter the
Kingdom of Heaven, but only those who do what my Father in Heaven
wants them to do.’. Then, let’s see what happens when a person is
baptized. Romans 6: 1-4 says: ‘what shall we say, shall we go on sinning
so that grace may increase? By no means! We died to sin, how can we live
in it any longer? Or don’t you know that all of us who were baptized into
Christ Jesus were baptized into his death? We were therefore buried with
him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised
from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new
life.’ What does this scripture says? When you are baptized you are
crucifying your earthly body into your death like Jesus who was crucified
and died on the cross. Like Jesus Christ who was raised from the dead
37
through the glory of the Father; so, you will be raised clothed with the
spiritual body through Jesus Christ. ‘For all of you who were baptized into
Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ (Galatians 3: 27).’ That is why
He says: ‘before long, the world will not see me anymore, but you will see
me. Because I live you will live (John 14: 19). This earth is reserved for fire.
2 Peter3: 7 say: ‘by the same word the present heavens and earth are
reserved for fire, being kept for the Day of Judgment and destruction of
ungodly people.’ His fury will be conflagrating for people who rejected
and denounced his salvation. Revelation 21:7-8 says: ‘He who overcomes
will inherit all this: and I will be his God and he will be my son. But the
cowardly, the unbelieving, the vile, the murderers, the sexually immoral,
those who practice magic arts, the idolaters and all liars-their place will be
in the fiery lake of burning sulfur. This is the second death.’ So, why does
God condemns cowards? You see that a coward is the first victim in the
list of sinners whose ‘place will be in the fiery lake of burning sulfur.’ Is it a
sin to be a coward? Why? Is he or she because he or she can't fight? Yes!
It can be a sin to be a coward. Why? Because, it takes a brave and a bold
person to take the initiative towards the right direction; that is why I
encourage every single soul who will read this book to make a decision to
repent and accept Jesus as a Lord and savior and do good.
